Music Reviews

Nouse's Best Albums of 2013

By Gracie Daw

2013 saw many things, including the death of Margaret Thatcher, the 'Iron Lady', the birth of a future king and Miley Cyrus breaking the internet. But the music released this year was phenomenal as well. Nouse's writers take you through some of the albums that shaped 2013.

Album Review: Jake Bugg - Shangri La

By James Bithell

Kate Mitchell considers Jake Bugg's musical progression over the course of one year in his new album, Shangri-La.

Album Review: Lorde - Pure Heroine

By James Bithell

Victoria Chater-Lea is refreshed by Lorde's fresh new perspective to the trends currently dominating chart music.

Live Review: Vampire Weekend

By James Bithell

Kate Mitchell heads to Leeds to review Vampire Weekend as they tour their senior album.

Album Review: Foals - Holy Fire

By James Bithell

Alex Killeen delves into the new Foals' album but finds the album's production too intrusive to its sound.

Album Review: Tinie Tempah - Demonstration

By James Bithell

Anoosh Djavaheri reviews as Tinie Tempah attempts to replicate his debut success, perhaps too closely.

Album Review: Lady Gaga - Artpop

By James Bithell

Lady Gaga's album has merit but lacks originality, a quality her fans love her for, writes Hatti Linnell.

Live Review: Jake Bugg

Amber Benbow-Hart is left underwhelmed by the Mercury nominee's performance in Doncaster.

Album Review: The Marshall Mathers LP II - Eminem

By James Bithell

The Marshall Mathers LP II sees Eminem attempt to recapture his old ferocity, but is it another case of commercial over commendable? Anoosh Djavaheri reviews.

Album Review: London Grammar - If You Wait

By James Bithell

The trip-hop trio, London Grammar, have produced their debut within a year of releasing their first EP. Laura Simpson reviews.

Album Review: Arcade Fire - Reflektor

By James Bithell

Arcade Fire's fourth album is a daring and emotional masterpiece. Alex Killeen reviews.

Keep It Unreal With Mr Scruff - On Campus Review

Alex Donaldson reviews Mr Scruff's incredible five and a half hour set, from right here on campus.

Album Review: Katy Perry - Prism

By James Bithell

Katy Perry's new album conveys a new level of maturity which is beneficial, writes Katie Woodard.

Live Review: Bowling For Soup

Charlotte Wainwright and Luke Price were there to say goodbye to the "band you can wave to" in their Farewell UK tour.

Live Review: Arctic Monkeys

The Arctic Monkeys have had a career unmatched by any other band since Oasis. Hatti Linnell reviews at their first set of UK dates since 2011.

Album Review: Panic at the Disco - Too weird to live, too rare to die!

By James Bithell

A final track which abandons the fluid electro sound is unable to distract from a unique piece of musical mastery. Jess Burgess reviews.

Review: Kids on Glass Houses Live

KIGH stormed through a seventeen-song set list in under 90 minutes. It looks like the Kids from the Valleys are all grown up. Vee Wells reviews.

Review: Gin and Juice

Despite rumours Gin and Juice is back. We review the first night of the new uni year.

Album Review: The Weeknd - Kiss Land

By James Bithell

After the success of the triple-sided Trilogy, The Weeknd returned recently with follow-up Kiss Land. Francesca Donovan reviews.

Review: Live and Loud 2013

First year Katy Sandalls gives the account of her Live and Loud 2013

In Pictures: Live and Loud 2013

Live and Loud was bigger than ever before. Agatha Torrance was there to experience the spectacle.

In Tweets: Live and Loud 2013

Live and Loud was just that, and drew a massive reaction online. Here's the best of tweets from the Hes Eastern front

The 10 Commandments of Live and Loud

There ain't no party like an S Club Party, and other important rules for Live and Loud revelling. And life.

Preview: The Transcender Series

By James Bithell

Max Bond previews the latest in cutting-edge music

Album Review: Manic Street Preachers - Rewind the Film

By James Bithell

Strikingly nostalgic and hauntingly meditative; Katrina Northern reviews Manic Street Preachers' new gem

Album Review: Kings of Leon - Mechanical Bull

By James Bithell

Blunt and repetitive - Katrina Northern reviews Kings of Leon's newest studio offering

Album Review: CHVRCHES - The Bones of What You Believe

By James Bithell

Presenting intelligent pop married with energetic electronica, CHVRCHES' first full length album is catchy and engaging; Alex Osborne reviews

Album review: Goldfrapp - Tales Of Us

By James Bithell

If you're willing to get lost in its stories over the autumn months, then kick back and enjoy, says George Wood.

Album Review: Arctic Monkeys - AM

By James Bithell

Arctic Monkeys' AM has been one of the most hyped releases of the year, but can any album meet such expectations? Alex Donaldson and Harry Harland offer two perspectives

Live Review: Sigur Ros

By James Bithell

Kate Mitchell reviews the mesmerising and majestic Sigur Ros
